introBlurb: The National School Lunch Program is a federally assisted meal program operating in public and nonprofit private schools and residential child care institutions. It provides nutritionally balanced, low-cost or free lunches to children each school day.
englishLanguageNameBlurb: I prefer to complete the application in English
spanishLanguageNameBlurb: Prefiero llenar la solicitud en español
chineseLanguageNameBlurb: 我更愿意完成在西班牙语中的应用
frenchLanguageNameBlurb: Je préfère remplir la demande en espagnol
vietnameseLanguageNameBlurb: Tôi muốn hoàn thành ứng dụng tiếng Tây Ban Nha
tagalogLanguageNameBlurb: I prefer to complete the application in English
koreanLanguageNameBlurb: 난 스페인어에서 응용 프로그램 작성을 선호 합니다
accountInfoBlurb: * indicates optional fields. We recommend using a password so you can access your application later.
householdRoleBlurb: By understanding your role within your household, we can better tailor the application to help guide you.
caseNumberBlurb: Do you or someone in your household participate in one of these programs: ...
childrenBlurb: List all infants, children, and students enrolled in and up to grade 12 living in your household. You will also need to report your children's income which is defined as money received from outside the household that is paid directly to the children
addChildIsStudent: Is this child currently a student?
addChildIsFoster: Is this child currently a foster child?
addChildIsHomelessMigrantRunaway: Is this child currently homeless, a migrant, or a runaway?
